title: Mortgage applications drop after the Fed takes a little juice out of the bond market
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, December 24, 2013
contentencoded: Applications for home mortgages in the U.S. have dropped to a record low since the Federal Reserve announced its plans to "taper," or slow its bond-buying program. Folks in the bond market sold off, mortgages rates went up, and mortgages, well, they didn't look as great. Nicolas Retsinas, senior lecturer of real estate at Harvard Business School, explains what's happening to Marketplace Morning Report.
